author: gathere
title: Grow the avocado producer
description: A falta de informação e tecnologias adequadas impedem que os produtores atinjam seu potencial financeiro e capacidade de produção

f6_assessments.q0: The author of the proposal states that there is a technological barrier that prevents avocado growers from reaching their financial potential. This is a problem that seems to me to be a sensible one for the region and it would have been ideal if data were presented to support his arguments. In an attempt to solve this problem, the proponent points to blockchain technology to deliver solutions such as "predictive farming, market finding, etc.". Unfortunately, no details are provided on how this solution will be implemented, and no metrics are provided to evaluate whether they are aligned with the objective of this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Unfortunately, the proposal author only indicates that he is a graduate of the University of Wollongong with a degree in civil engineering. He also has experience in the avocado production industry. It does not include references to verify competence, nor does it detail how the resources will be allocated. As a result, the community cannot accurately assess the feasibility of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: A proposal's auditability section is critical to the allocation of funds. Yet, there is no information included to enable it to be evaluated. As a result, I recommend that the proponent for other catalyst cycles prepare a detailed roadmap and success metrics. By doing so, the community can be confident that they will be able to keep track of the proposal's progress and audit it.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal approaches a very interesting subject with great potential, unfortunately it has remained in a draft stage, that prevents it from being properly understood and assessed.
f6_assessments.q1: Besides the mandatory field for relevant experience, problem statement and solution, the proposal does not offer any other information. In this form, I will suggest to have it resubmitted in a future fund with the necessary info added, to be able to be evaluated properly.
f6_assessments.q2: As stated above, the proposal is still in a draft stage, missing most of the relevant information and offering only a small glimpse into its potential direction. As such, it cannot be evaluated for its progress.

f6_assessments.q0: Being from Brazil I can guarantee that farming is a huge source of the PIB. However, there is no explanation at all about where to focus, how it is going to be done, metrics, KPIs, and how it'll add value to the challenge itself. There's no further explanation o how this proposal, which seem like an idea, relates with this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Unfortunately there is no methodology, no timetable, no roadmap, nothing written that shows us that this proposal has highly chance of being implemented.
Furthermore, the proposal request 1/5 of the budget and give no detail about how it'll be used.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no metrics, no KPI and no roadmap. Furthermore, there is no a clear solution which address the problem of this challenge. Therefore, since there is no information whatsoever, it's improbable that this proposal could be audited.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has not included any information about how they will go about solving the issues they listed. I see the potential value in their ideas, but I would need more specific details to give more detailed feedback. (score given: 1)
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has only provided brief information about their experience. Also, given that there is no plan for how the proposer intends to carry out this proposal, I cannot say that it will be successful. (score given: 1)
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has not provided any information about how the proposal can be audited. I would recommend including more information about potential key performance indicators to make the proposal auditable. (score given: 1)

f6_assessments.q0: Using Blockchain to improve the lives of producers is in line with this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
If you do not get funded in Fund 7 and you  propose in the next fund please review the following suggestions:
- Describe how your experience is going to make this proposal successful.  Will you engage other skills that will contribute to your success.
-Define a Goal of what and how you expect to help the farmers using blockchain.
-Define Time Lines and dates that demonstrate when and how complete functional parts of your project will be completed.
-Create an actionable budget that is in line with the total challenge. Remember there may be many proposals that need to be funded so break your project into parts that can be completed and fund those.
f6_assessments.q2:
Please review these suggestions:
- Clearly state when and where there is a place in your project that the community can look and see that you have achieved that task within budget.  Clearly Defined Time Lines, Objectives and KPI's all help your project to be sufficiently audited.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a draft proposal of only 50 words. There is nothing to be assessed. Even the short description provided is really vague and can be summed up by "Use blockchain technology to help avocado producer improve their lives with $100k".
f6_assessments.q1: Some experience is given by a few words but we really need external professional links with proof of experience or link to existing projects. Words are not enough.
f6_assessments.q2: Since almost no information is being provided there is no way to assess this criterium.

f6_assessments.q0: Both problem and solution could be way more detailed. It is hard to define the impact this proposal will have on the avocado producer
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer could have added more about him and a (potential) team. Also there is no budget, roadmap, risk-assessment. Maybe re-do the proposal and submit a more detailed one on the next fund.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is really short and doesn't contain a lot of informations. Unfortunately it is not sufficient to audit the proposal, the future progress or success of it.

f6_assessments.q0:
This seem like a good idea but lack detail.
the following information are not Provided:
- Detailed information about the proponents, including external links that allow verification of experience or other relevant information.
- How does the proposal impact the metrics of the "Grow Latin America Grow Cardano" challenge?
- How does the proposal work on the issues planned by the challenge?
- Describe in detail how the requested budget will be spent
- What will be the metrics of the proposal (KPIs), which allow monitoring the progress of the proposal.
- Definition of success after 3, 6 and 12 months
- Expected date of public release

f6_assessments.q0: Incomplete proposal, little explanation beyond the problem statement
f6_assessments.q1: Please provide a plan so that it can be evaluated. As it stands, there is not plan so it cannot be implemented successfully. Given the widely varying experience quoted in all the other proposal submitted, some evidence should be provided.
f6_assessments.q2: Nothing to audit since project definition, KPIs and implementation description is missing.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal, it seems that those proposals do not have enough time to update it before the deadline ends. So it's basically an idea but not really a plan, in such a way that even though the idea is good and can be successfully implemented, we don't know how to implement it and for example. For example, how many people will be affected. without at least a basic plan
This proposal also addresses an agricultural development problem in Latin America, but the proposed solution seems generic and unrelated to Latin America. The proposal should be more detailed on how the project will bring value to the Cardano ecosystem and in a sustainable way, or how it might evolve in the future, once funded and after the funding is used.
f6_assessments.q1:
I disagree that the information herein is sufficient to gauge the progress and success of this proposal. Because of the lack of information, it is impossible to know if the project is feasible or not.
There are no details regarding the author team. A sketchy description of the experience, who is behind this recommendation, do they have any experience, don't have any links to their profile so we can check that, no have grounds to believe in the success of the proposal
Challenges and risks have not been identified.
f6_assessments.q2:
Suggested auditability is low, as it does not show roadmap along with development plan, detailed explanation of each step, milestones and deliverables of each part, progress and some ways to community quantify Proposal Success as data and KPI
I would love to see the team develop Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for the project and connect the KPIs to milestones in the future project roadmap (timeline).
Also, considering the amount of funds required, there should be a clear detailed explanation of how the funds will be allocated to achieve the mentioned milestones. The USD 100,000 claim amount is 1/5th of the amount of this challenge, but there is no explanation as to the amount requested.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on predictive farming, the market finds, export processing using blockchain will drastically improve the lives of the producers. Since this proposal is not completed, the solution is still very abstract, not clear impact, however, in my point of view, this idea is very worth trying for completing in the future. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's experience is briefly described as having entrepreneurial experience in avocado export, electronics import, and sales and service, however, there is no proof/link for verification. Therefore, there is no proof of feasibility. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: Since this is an incomplete proposal where transparency can't be guaranteed. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.

solution: A agricultura preditiva, a descoberta de mercado, o processamento de exportação usando a cadeia de bloqueio irá melhorar drasticamente a vida dos produtores
experience:
Universidade de Wollongong Alumni, Engenharia Civil
Experiência empresarial em exportação de abacate, importação de produtos eletrônicos e vendas e serviços
